image.altText: A concept image of the proposed Hobart stadium at Macquarie Poi nt.

props.synopsis: An order to build the Macquarie Point AFL stadium on Hobart's waterfront has passed the lower house after a lengthy six-hour debate, paving the way for a deciding vote in the upper house next month.

title.children: 'Yes' vote on Macquarie Point as AFL stadium order sails through lower house

image.altText: A man in protecive clothing holds a large fish.

props.synopsis: A salmon mass mortality event caused by a bacterial outbreak has given scientists "a lot of genetic knowledge" to put to use in a selective breeding program.

title.children: Tasmanian salmon resilient to bacterial disease bred like 'stud bulls'

image.altText: close up of sanjeev gupta in glasses

props.synopsis: Sanjeev Gupta is gone from the Whyalla steelworks but his troubles are far from over, with a former high-level international executive who oversaw the South Australian operation now suing for US $30 million in unpaid wages and bonuses.

title.children: Sanjeev Gupta accused of deliberately losing phones in unpaid wages case

image.altText: A person crouches next to a graffiti artwork of a smiling character, their face is hidden.

props.synopsis: Ever noticed the hundreds of smiley faces graffitied on buildings, the back of road signs, guardrails and bridges around Tasmania? The artist says the world needs more joy.

title.children: These 'silly, lighthearted' smiley tags show up all over Tasmania. This is who spray-paints them

image.altText: A couple sitting in their backyard holding their two small dogs in their laps.

props.synopsis: Under the updated legislation, landlords now need a "reasonable" rationale to say no to a tenant having pets — and that reasonableness can only be decided by an independent tribunal.

title.children: Tasmanian landlords can't have a 'no pets' rule anymore. Here's how it works

image.altText: Processor at Hellyer mine.

props.synopsis: The state government has directed Hellyer Gold Mines to cease operations at its mine in north-west Tasmania. It says the company has significantly fallen behind on its debts.

title.children: Gold mine 'appalled and astonished' after government shuts it down

image.altText: Dozens of union members with matching t-shirts and placards at a rally.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's public sector workers have knocked back a 3 per cent pay rise that the government insists is fair given the tight budget. But what does 'fair' look like when compared to other states? Reporter Selina Bryan takes a look.

title.children: TassieCast: Union pressure for more public sector pay

image.altText: Two women and two men standing at a podium talking to reporters

props.synopsis: While many Liberals who wanted to keep net zero say they are happy with the position the party has landed on, some despondent moderates fear electoral oblivion in metropolitan seats.

title.children: Liberal moderates split over net zero move, with some fearing for city seats

image.altText: Reflection of person holding umbrella below Nasdaq sign

props.synopsis: The ASX falls steeply in response to a sharp drop on Wall Street overnight, which was led by a big decline in tech stocks. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX drops sharply after Wall St tumbles

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Is this the start of a 'correction'?

image.altText: A tall thin rocket takes off from launch pad, vertically, against a blue sky.

props.synopsis: Blue Origin has successfully launched the 98-metre New Glenn rocket with a pair of NASA spacecraft destined for Mars.

title.children: Blue Origin launches huge rocket carrying twin NASA spacecraft to Mars

image.altText: A man, Brett Button, standing in a crowd of people with news cameras surrounding him

props.synopsis: The bus driver who crashed and killed 10 wedding guests while injuring 25 others in the NSW Hunter Valley has lost an appeal on the severity of his sentence.

title.children: Wedding bus crash driver loses court appeal against his sentence

image.altText: Netanyahu in a suit in front of a wooden wall and two israeli flags

props.synopsis: The Israeli PM says he will not push for a pardon or concede guilt in his long-running corruption trial, less than a day after thanking Donald Trump for urging Israel's president to clear his record.

title.children: Netanyahu insists he won't seek pardon after Trump's letter

image.altText: Storm clouds brewing over a rural highway

props.synopsis: Peak severe weather season is arriving, and an influx of tropical moisture will fuel thunderstorms in all Australian states and territories between Friday and Sunday.

title.children: Supercell risk as 72-hour storm outbreak to light up skies

image.altText: Cynthia Erivo and Ariana Grande smile at each other and hold hands

props.synopsis: Video shared across social media shows a man jumping over a crowd-control barrier, running towards Grande and putting his arms around the singer.

title.children: Cynthia Erivo pushes Australian 'serial intruder' off Ariana Grande at event

image.altText: A photo taken through venetian blinds of round steel tables and stools can be seen outdoors on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: Marlo Baragwanath warns the state government's crackdown on youth offenders will result in less humane treatment in detention centres.

title.children: Extraordinary intervention by ombudsman in Victorian youth crime crackdown

image.altText: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, Virginia Giuffre and Ghislaine Maxwell posing for a picture.

props.synopsis: The former prince has repeatedly denied ever meeting Ms Giuffre, including during an infamous interview with the BBC in 2019.

title.children: Epstein email says Andrew had photo taken with accuser Virginia Giuffre

image.altText: A grain silo looms in front of a starry purple, pink and green sky

props.synopsis: Another week is behind us Can you recall the big news stories of the past seven days?

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Black Friday sales, a stunning aurora and a whole lot of bagpipes

image.altText: A young girl in a school uniform poses in front of a garden

props.synopsis: Parents of children at a Sydney school where a five-year-old girl was fatally struck are demanding action to improve road safety after it emerged two more children were hit by cars nearby before the girl's death.

title.children: Parents demand action as three children hit by cars near Sydney school

image.altText: A purple and green sky with the silhouettes of big trees

props.synopsis: The strength of the latest geomagnetic storms has seen the aurora australis light up skies across a larger part of the country than usual.

title.children: They're called the southern lights. But they dazzled Australians further north

image.altText: Ben Stokes reacts after the wicket of Jacob Bethell

props.synopsis: Ben Stokes appears embarrassed with almost every single one of his six wickets as England's bowling attack leaves much to be desired in their only tour match before the Ashes opener in Perth.

title.children: Stokes reactions tell full story of England's struggles in Ashes warm-up

image.altText: Eliesa Katoa of Tonga is attended to by a trainer, holding a towel, bleeding an with head injuries

props.synopsis: A leading concussion expert calls for sporting bodies to strengthen their protocols on players who are concussed before and during matches.

title.children: Neuroscientist calls for doctors at games following Katoa concussions

image.altText: A female golfer looks down the fairway after her ball after completing her first shot on a hole at an LPGA tournament.

props.synopsis: Kai Trump, teenage granddaughter of US President Donald Trump, has a rough start to The Annika tournament after receiving a sponsors invite to take part in the LPGA Tour event.

title.children: Trump's granddaughter last in LPGA debut after receiving wildcard

image.altText: A Rex Airlines flight lands in an airport.

props.synopsis: Regional councils say they want security bonds on airline carriers who use their airports to ensure stability for travellers.

title.children: Councils at the end of their tether with continued airline failures

image.altText: The family of a 49-year-old WA man, whose death was initially linked to the Optus Triple-Zero outage, say they have been kept in the dark by authorities.

props.synopsis: The family of a Perth man whose death was tied to the Optus Triple Zero outage claims authorities left them in the dark for weeks and are still unsure how his death was connected to the telco failure.

title.children: This man's death was linked to the Optus outage, but his family still don't know how

image.altText: A woman with ceremonial face paint and a feathered headdress stands in front of a palm tree.

props.synopsis: Australian filmmaker Lynette Wallworth accompanies two palliative care doctors researching psilocybin use deep into the Amazon jungle to see if it can change the end-of-life experience for terminal patients.

title.children: Near-death experience opens minds to a better way of dying

image.altText: An empty mail box.

props.synopsis: The average first-time home buyer in the US is older than ever, but a new proposal could leave them paying off a mortgage until old age.

title.children: Trump officials float 50-year 'gamechanger' mortgages. Others aren't sure

image.altText: Two happy dogs, one large and one small, on a beach.

props.synopsis: The huge range of dog breeds that exists today is often thought of as a modern phenomenon, but new research suggests this vast diversity started thousands of years ago.

title.children: Once wolves became dogs they quickly diversified, study shows

image.altText: a victorian era looking homestead

props.synopsis: A Victorian-era manor that hosts ghost tours and promotes itself as Australia's most haunted house is on the market for the first time in more than half a century.

title.children: Buyers from across the country drawn to 140-year-old 'haunted' mansion

image.altText: GettyImages-2181573573

props.synopsis: Kyra Cooney-Cross is nominated for the goal of the year award, but has stiff competition from the player the award is named after.

title.children: Matildas star up for goal of the year award after long-range stunner

image.altText: A man in khaki shorts and a hat stands on rocks overlooking a rugged tree-lined gorge.

props.synopsis: A WA pastoralist says he will not stand in the way of the bullets aimed at the donkeys on his remote property, but he will not kill the animals he says have had a positive environmental impact.

title.children: Grazier accepts donkey culling decision but will not do it himself

image.altText: An unidentified child care worker holding hands with a child.

props.synopsis: Almost a decade after one was recommended by the Royal Commission into Institutional Responses to Child Sexual Abuse.

title.children: Working with children check tracker established amid pressure on child care

image.altText: A man's hand holds large blueberries.

props.synopsis: New rules around a popular insecticide could lead to lower blueberry production, but growers are confident the industry will adapt.

title.children: Insecticide suspension could have 'massive impact' on blueberry crops

image.altText: A small koala joey sits in a baby carrier strapped to a woman's chest, while she feeds him a bottle.

props.synopsis: A Victorian medical charity helps divert 15,000 tonnes of medical waste from landfill while giving wildlife carers the resources to nurse injured animals back to health.

title.children: Medical waste destined for landfill used to nurse wildlife back to health
